importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date when the article reports that President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy for his prostate cancer, marking a milestone in his treatment journey.
Biden’s personal office announced in May that he had been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones, setting the stage for subsequent treatments.
Earlier this month, Biden began a pill regimen to treat prostate cancer, indicating an early phase of treatment before radiation therapy.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from May 2025 to October 2025 represents the timeline of Biden’s cancer treatment progression, from diagnosis and initial therapy to completion of radiation therapy.

keyTakeAways: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy as part of his treatment for prostate cancer.
The cancer was diagnosed as aggressive and had spread to his bones, prompting a comprehensive treatment plan.
Biden had previously begun a pill regimen to manage the disease and underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer.
His daughter Ashley shared a video and photo celebrating the completion of radiation therapy, highlighting the emotional and public significance of the milestone.
Biden expressed confidence in overcoming the illness, stating that the cancer had not penetrated vital organs and that his bones were strong.
The treatment progression follows a public health narrative where a prominent political figure’s health journey receives widespread attention and underscores awareness of cancer care.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy for an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones, following a diagnosis in May 2025. He previously began a pill regimen and underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer. His daughter Ashley shared public messages celebrating the milestone, expressing gratitude for the medical team at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia. Despite the challenges, Biden remains optimistic, stating he feels strong and believes he can overcome the illness. He is scheduled to speak at public events in Boston and Omaha, demonstrating that his health journey does not impede his political engagement.
title: Biden completes a course of radiation therapy for cancer treatment
